CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 2, 1955, pg. 16 reads: "Daffodil Community Club...presented a table and chairs to complete a dining room at the Home for Aged on Lemington Avenue, with Mrs. James Allen, president of the club, making the presentation. Mrs. Jimmie Mellon, second vice president of the board, received the gift.  Pictured are Mmes. Dorothy Wheeler, M.L. Emanuel, Estelle Shelton, Batty Smith, Margaret Terry, James Allen, Alvina M. Waters, acting executive director of the home; Rose Stokes, Jimmie M. Mellon, Mary Wall, Geraldine Bradford, Marguerite Smith, Bertha Brewer.  Seated: Mmes. Carrie Anderson and Jessie Jackson. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Daffodil Community Club members, including, seated: Carrie Anderson and Jessie Jackson; standing: Dorothy Wheeler, M.L. Emanuel, Estelle Shelton, Batty Smith, Margaret Terry, Mrs. James Allen, Alvina M. Waters, acting executive director of the home; Rose Stokes, Jimmie M. Mellon, Mary Wall, Geraldine Bradford, Marguerite Smith, and Bertha Brewer, posed around donated table and chairs in the Lemington Home for Aged
